thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Tuesday, 27 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: South Africa's parliament endorses land expropriation without compensation

author: Reuters Editorial
title: South Africa's parliament endorses land expropriation without compensation
text:
CAPE TOWN, Feb 27 (Reuters) - South Africaâ€™s parliament on Tuesday passed a motion brought by the radical left party, Economic Freedom Fighters (EFF), to carry out land expropriation without compensation, a key pillar of the ruling ANC government and new President Cyril Ramaphosa.
The motion, which would include a review of the constitution, was brought by leader of the EFF Julius Malema and was passed by an overwhelming majority of 241 votes in favour versus 83 votes against the proposal. (Reporting by Wendell Roelf; Editing by James Macharia)
